to_address: "Speakup is a screen review system for Linux." <speakup@braille.uwo.ca>
subject: Re: DECTalk Express driver
body:
Hi, Now that the dectalk express driver is fixed would it be possible to 
update the rpms for fedora core 6 to 2.6.20 with this new driver?  I am 
currently running 2.6.19 as downloaded from speakupmodified.org and it works 
fine but like to keep my system as updated as possible.  Do you usually make 
announcements when a new rpm of the fedora kernels are released and if not 
what is the easiest way to check?  What is this read all mode?
----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Kirk Reiser" 
To: 
Sent: Friday, April 13, 2007 4:14 PM
Subject: DECTalk Express driver


> Hello folks:  For those of you waiting on a working DECTalk Express
> driver for 2.6.20 and above I checked in a redesigned driver this
> afternoon.  It does not have read all mode and I won't work on
> reinstating that until we have the git repository speakup version
> working correctly.
>
>  Kirk
>
> -- 
>
> Kirk Reiser The Computer Braille Facility
> e-mail: kirk@braille.uwo.ca University of Western Ontario
> phone: (519) 661-3061
